name: Great Question
headline: User research on autopilot.
description:
Great Question puts customer research on autopilot - from recruiting participants, scheduling interviews, sending surveys or prototype tests - and sharing what you learn with your team.

Companies like Adidas Runtastic, O'Reilly Media & MainStreet use us to put their customers at the center of their product, design & marketing decisions.

founders.name: Ned Dwyer, Founder / CEO
founders.description:
Founder of Great Question - the customer research platform to streamline interviews, surveys and prototype tests with your own customers.

Previously built Elto (acquired by GoDaddy).

Australian living in Oakland.

founders.name: PJ Murray, Founder
founders.description:
CTO & Founder of Great Question. Previously founded & sold Elto (with Ned)

Software development for 10 years. Primarily working with early start startups. Mostly Rails. 

South African born Kiwi living in Australia.

## It’s tough to scale UX research programs. Your tool stack makes it worse.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64b6a9e4e2e8460e691fd20f/66fb0f29b59e588a0ef3ffd4_red-x-icon.svg)
Recruiting participants requires multiple tools, endless emails, and a data analyst.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64b6a9e4e2e8460e691fd20f/66fb0f29b59e588a0ef3ffd4_red-x-icon.svg)
It’s tough to adhere to customer data privacy standards and keep your customers safe.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64b6a9e4e2e8460e691fd20f/66fb0f29b59e588a0ef3ffd4_red-x-icon.svg)
Visibility across projects is murky — so it’s hard to report on what’s actually happening.
## Consolidate all your research tools in one enterprise-grade platform.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64b6a9e4e2e8460e691fd20f/66fb135562a3cb5e8dab48d3_green-check-icon.svg)
Reduce recruitment from 8 weeks to <20 minutes with our CRM integrations.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64b6a9e4e2e8460e691fd20f/66fb135562a3cb5e8dab48d3_green-check-icon.svg)
Get full visibility across research with our UX research repository —from insights to reporting.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64b6a9e4e2e8460e691fd20f/66fb135562a3cb5e8dab48d3_green-check-icon.svg)
Easily craft and implement excellent standards of practice across all projects.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64b6a9e4e2e8460e691fd20f/66fb154bd11247bc06ac4701_UserResearch_EasiestToDoBusinessWith_EaseOfDoingBusinessWith.svg)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64b6a9e4e2e8460e691fd20f/66fb154f19216b7a1b8ec9b1_UserResearch_HighPerformer_HighPerformer.svg)

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Great Question**

Founded in 2020, Great Question emerged from Y Combinator's Batch W21 and is headquartered in Oakland, CA. The company’s mission is straightforward yet powerful: "User research on autopilot." With a talented team of 22, led by group partner Dalton Caldwell, Great Question streamlines the often tedious and complex process of customer research, making it accessible and efficient for businesses.

The core offering of Great Question is its all-in-one UX research platform. It simplifies the cumbersome tasks involved in user research—like recruiting participants, managing schedules, conducting interviews, distributing surveys, and testing prototypes. This seamless integration allows teams to focus on what matters most: understanding their users.

**Clientele and Impact**

Great Question has gained traction among notable companies such as Adidas Runtastic, O'Reilly Media, and MainStreet. These organizations leverage the platform to put their customers at the heart of their product design and marketing decisions, ultimately enhancing their decision-making with real user insights.

**Product Features**

Great Question provides a robust suite of features designed to simplify the research process:

1. **Recruitment**: Access over 3 million participants for studies.
2. **Conducting Research**: Schedule interviews (1:1 or group), run surveys, and conduct unmoderated tests—all powered by easy-to-use interfaces.
3. **Incentives Management**: Automatically manage participant incentives, streamlining the recruitment process.
4. **Analysis and Sharing**: Use advanced AI tools to synthesize research findings quickly and share insights with stakeholders effectively.

Their platform fosters collaboration, inviting team members to watch interviews in real time and enabling sharing of recorded insights through highlight reels.

**Current Developments**

Great Question is dedicated to improving user experience with ongoing updates and features. They recently scheduled webinars such as “Measuring Impact & Effort: How the Researcher Effort Score Can Help!” to engage with the research community actively.

**Data Security and Compliance**

The company places high importance on data security, ensuring compliance with industry standards like SOC 2, GDPR, and HIPAA. This allows enterprise customers to conduct their research with confidence, knowing their data is protected.

**Conclusion**

In a world where understanding the user is pivotal, Great Question is providing a much-needed solution. Its integrated approach not only saves time but also drives a deeper understanding of customer needs—ultimately leading to better products and marketing strategies. If you’re in UX research, checking out Great Question's platform might just be the upgrade you need to simplify your workflow and elevate your insights. 

For more information, visit [Great Question](https://greatquestion.co).
